Chmn. @RepEliotEngel: U.S. policy should be to respect the desires of the people of #Venezuela, help ease the worsening humanitarian crisis in that country, and work in multilateral institutions and with the region's countries to pressure Maduro to respect the people's will. 5/5
Chairman @RepEliotEngel: Maduro is a brutal dictator who has done devastating harm to #Venezuela and its people. 4/5

Chairman @RepEliotEngel: We need to be cognizant of the risks of keeping American diplomats in #Venezuela. While Maduro's legitimate term as President has ended, he maintains total control over the country's security apparatus. 3/5

Chairman @RepEliotEngel: Armed American military intervention in Venezuela is not an option. I've been troubled by President Trump's past suggestions that he would consider American military intervention in #Venezuela. 2/5

Chairman @RepEliotEngel: The situation in #Venezuela is volatile, and I urge the Administration to take an approach that supports the Venezuelan people, protects American lives, helps ease the humanitarian crisis, respects human rights, and avoids violence. 1/5
https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/2019/1/engel-mccaul-urge-pompeo-to-prioritize-safety-of-u-s-diplomats-in-venezuela … pic.twitter.com/oUXZpwTLPe
